
```{r ShapeDescriptionExamples, echo=FALSE, fig.height=2, fig.width=5.5, fig.align="center", out.width='140%',fig.cap="Some common shapes of the distribution of qualitative data"}
par(mfrow = c(1, 4))
par(mar = c(4.1, 4.1, 3.5, 0.5),
    oma = c(0, 0, 0, 0))

blueTransparent <- rgb(0, 0, 1, 
                       alpha = 0.2, 
                       maxColorValue = 1)

set.seed(110110)

xx <- c( rchisq(300, 
                df = 2), 
         7,7,8,7,7,7,8,7,7,6)

hist( scales::rescale(xx, to = c(0, 5)), 
      xlab = "Values", 
      ylab = "Number of obs.",
      main = "A: Skewed\nright",
      axes = FALSE,
      col = plot.colour, 
      las = 1)
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 1)
box()


####

xx <- c( rchisq(300, 
                df = 1), 
         2, 2, 1, 1, 2, 0, 0)

xx <- max(xx) - xx
hist( scales::rescale(xx, to = c(0, 5)), 
      xlab = "Values", ylab="Number of obs.",
      main = "B: Skewed\nleft",
      axes = FALSE,
      col = plot.colour, 
      las = 1)
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 1)
box()


###

xx <- rnorm(500, mean=10)
hist( scales::rescale(xx, to = c(0, 10)), 
      xlab = "Values", ylab="Number of obs.",
      main = "C: Approx.\nsymmetric",
      axes = FALSE,
      col = plot.colour, 
      las = 1)
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 1)
box()


###


xx1 <- rnorm(500,
             mean = 0, 
             sd = 1)
xx2 <- rnorm(250,
             mean = 4, 
             sd = 1)
xx <- c( xx1[xx1 > 0], xx2)


hist( scales::rescale(xx, to = c(0, 10)),  
      right = TRUE,
      axes = FALSE,
      col = plot.colour, 
      las = 1,
      xlab = "Values",
      ylab = "Number of obs.", 
      main = "D: Bimodal\ndistribution")
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 1)
box()
```
